data.title: Improve rendering of keybindings for combining accents
data.body:
This is a spin off from #12682 for the issue pointed by @BairDev

Specifically, under the German Keyboard Layout (in Gnome/Mutter window manager), `ctrl+`` for toggle integrated terminal gets rendered with a combining accent and it looks a bit garbled, making appear that it is `ctrl + `` when in fact it should look more like `ctrl + ^`

Layout:

![image](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/7acd47da8677ca24757c60e068f408452d4c068e/68747470733a2f2f75706c6f61642e77696b696d656469612e6f72672f77696b6970656469612f636f6d6d6f6e732f332f33362f4b425f4765726d616e792e737667)

Rendered:

![F1 list](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2767014/19684557/23b0bde2-9ab8-11e6-81e3-be762995ec09.png)

data.title: Evaluating expression in the repl takes two Enter key presses
data.body:
#14171

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/19687072/56872812-9ac4-11e6-9254-2ff8ddb93746.png)

Since the repl now has suggest embedded it became a terrible experience since I always have to click <kbd>Enter</kbd> twice to evaluate anything: the first to accept the automatic suggestion that came up and the second to submit the expression.

data.title: Repl indicator is shifted a few pixels down
data.body:
#14171

In Windows:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/19686995/fedd521c-9ac3-11e6-91d1-3b9309d25f67.png)

data.title: Call stack subtitle makes no sense in multiple debug configurations
data.body:
#14171

Subtitle reads `Paused on breakpoint` when one instance is running and another is paused.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/19686810/2a759a0c-9ac3-11e6-982f-4ceb9c15a36d.png)

Also, when both are paused, it says `Paused on breakpoint`. Upon hitting `Play` to resume **one** of them, the subtitle disappears until the user selects the other program at which point it comes back, although nothing really has changed.

data.title: Exception in viewLines.ts
data.body:
I was editing a file, and this came up, couldn't reproduce it further. 😢 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/19686738/cf7e6d68-9ac2-11e6-9071-2b8fd25467d7.png)

data.title: Can't resume second debug instance through toolbar
Debug loses current line breakpoint decoration
Proposal  to save the context of opened files
data.body: Would be great if the editor provide us the functionality to save the context of the opened files and be able to save different contexts. this would be really useful when you works in different issues in the same project.

data.title: Hit count expression isn't validated
data.body:
Testing #13211

The hit count expression isn't validated and you can enter arbitrary text. Could at least to some lexical validation (digits and relational operators)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/19686538/d7502d98-9ac1-11e6-93e1-8fff19ae2ac3.png)

data.title: Threads/programs should always show whether they are running or otherwise
data.body:
#14171
- Set up two Node debug running configurations
- Hit <kbd>Play</kbd>

Debugging will pause on both programs but Code only shows me that one is paused:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/19686371/1405a174-9ac1-11e6-9f51-e53667552777.png)

There's no indication that the other program is also paused, only once the `Launch Program 1` section is expanded.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/19686387/2ab2fd36-9ac1-11e6-95b1-278ff8a0c747.png)

data.title: Hit count input box could provide hint about expression syntax
data.body:
Testing #13211

It would be nice to show the expression syntax for hit counts in the input box

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/19686370/128196fa-9ac1-11e6-8da3-f6dcc7ef8505.png)

Testing #13211

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/19686313/d53ba768-9ac0-11e6-82db-3308d070dfa7.png)

data.title: Irrelevant "information" message when using missing identifier for composite debugging
data.body:
#14171

``` json
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Program 1",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/app.js",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}"
        },
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Program 2",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/app2.js",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}"
        },
        {
            "type": "composite",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Both Programs",
            "configurationNames": [
                "fake"
            ]
        }
    ]
}
```

In this launch config, I reference a `fake` configuration which does not exist.

When pressing Play I get this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/19686159/48b244fa-9ac0-11e6-82be-a8754e521557.png)
- The message tells me to configure the launch config, which I already did.
- The message is an information, when it should be a warning/error, since the feature can't work without fixing the issue.

data.title: Intellisense Works With White Space
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: win10

Now 'Tab' and 'Enter' can trigger the intellisense word,  I hope it can be triggered with 'White Space' too.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10517310/19685907/5a9709f4-9af1-11e6-80cf-a3aa9dcb7d06.png)

data.title: Extension host debugging: reloading EH window doesn't restart debug session
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14171:
- start debugging an extension (e.g. vscode-node-debug)
- in EH window do 'reload window' (cmd-R)
- debug session terminates but doesn't restart; timeout after 10 seconds

data.title: Work items from visualstudio.com should not be visible when they are in a resolved or fixed state.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10.0.14393.0

Work items from visualstudio.com should not be visible in VSCode when they are in a resolved or fixed state.

![vs-code-resolved](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1965454/19684317/f17ff048-9a8c-11e6-9e19-d4f25b16fa8c.png)

I think that the item is visible in vscode because there is no filter on the list and it is showing all items that are assigned to me.

![bug1_vs_resolved](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1965454/19684553/34099d28-9a8e-11e6-8963-725b302a4780.png)

data.title: Reload button overkill
data.body: testing #14291 - Install an extension pack, reload, - uninstall the extension pack - 🐛 the extension viewlet is full of 'Reload buttons' showing that we might not be using the right UX for that...

data.title: Bad clicking when trying to uninstall
data.body:
testing  #14291

see attached gif

My mouse moves from the custom _uninstall button_, to a _native popup dialog_, to a _custom confirmation message_. I think that is crazy and a bad change of styles/UX metaphors

![oct-25-2016 13-27-23](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/19684321/df7460b2-9ab6-11e6-81ec-550e3632bf67.gif)

data.title: Unhelpful error message when uninstalling extension pack
data.body: testing #14291 Uninstall extension pack another pack depends on and see the following little helpful error message Instead, it should show me what pack depend on the one to be uninstalled and offer me to also uninstall those.

data.title: Extra confirmation message seems weird
data.body: testing #14291 Install an extension and see the extra confirmation message about it (attached below). It feels like we show that message because our UI fails to indicate that an extension pack is different from an extension. Instead of the message why don't we change the 'Install' button to something like _Install Extension Pack_

data.title: debug repl: sometimes intellisense comes into my way...
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0

Steps to Reproduce:
- in debug console type 'process.env'
- intellisense appears and shows a rather unhelpful "env" suggestion.
- press enter: the "env" suggestion disappears but the evaluate is not triggered
- press enter again: now  'process.env' is evaluated

I would prefer not to see intellisense in this case and have the first enter start the evaluation.

data.title: node-debug: preview does not trigger getters
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14305:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0

In debug console evaluate 'process.env'.
The resulting preview shows undefined but expanding shows correct values.

![2016-10-25_12-22-29](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/19682491/20622fe0-9aae-11e6-8420-3d16ed648524.png)

Problem: getters are not triggered when creating the preview.
